column1: Congratulations to my friend colleague and fellow Hoosier @repjimbanks on being elected Chair of the @republicanstudy.  Excited about the next 2 years at the RSC under your leadership!

The public/private partnership of #OperationWarpSpeed is proving to be a success in the fight against COVID. While these vaccines continue to work on approval continue to wear masks social distance wash hands and stay home if you are sick. https://t.co/XQrGE4stAY

It is clear that the unconstitutional vote by text scheme proposed by @SpeakerPelosi is nothing more than a power grab that consolidates her power while allowing her members to stay home indefinitely and collect a paycheck. We must return to work on behalf of the American people.
Happy Birthday @USMC. Thank you for protecting America. https://t.co/PUHMGyo0b2
Great news about the @pfizer vaccine. That said I wonder if they had the data before the election? The timing of this information appears to be blatantly political. Should Congress investigate?

I am honored to receive the Friend of Farm Bureau award at Steinkamp Farms today in Evansville. Our Hoosier farmers feed millions throughout the nation and the world and I am proud to be their voice in Congress. https://t.co/GvigEAvRJf

I am proud to have been awarded the Guardian of Small Business award by @nfib. Hoosier small businesses are the backbone of our economic engine and I will continue to empower them to grow and thrive. #smallbizguardian https://t.co/SwkFHrjxBP

Amy Coney Barrett is supremely qualified to be a Justice on the highest court in the land. President Trump made a great choice in nominating her and I am confident she will do a great job for America.

Big tech companies that control social media are aggressively censoring speech they don’t like. A law that was enacted before social media outlets even existed makes it legal for these inconsistent actions. It is time to revisit and modernize their Section 230 protections. https://t.co/d8Q5tlVZIR

Having access to clean water is vital to to the life ofhealthy happy Hoosiers. I am excited to see this investment in Petersburg to improve their existing water supply infrastructure. Thanks to @SecretaryRoss @US_EDA for this important investment in rural America!
https://t.co/H40doeagPD

Today is @MFGDay! Indiana is home to some of the best businesses join me in celebrating Hoosier manufacturers and supporting the movement to inspire the next generation of great American creators. #MFGDay20 #CreatorsWanted

Dems are telling Americans that the GOP support a tax code that favors the “rich”. False. We support low taxes for all. The Dem Covid-19 package they just voted for repeals the SALT deduction cap the GOP put in place in 2017. The result: a huge tax cut for the “rich”. Projecting?
My thoughts and prayers are with @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS. I am optimistic they will come through this with support of the nation. Doctor’s orders sleep rest and hydration.
@realDonaldTrump @FLOTUS prayers for a mild case of Covid-19 and a swift recovery.

Small businesses across America are suffering. Instead of allowing them to access unused PPP funds Pelosi is playing politics with their livelihoods. I’ve signed a discharge petition to stop Pelosi from holding PPP funds hostage & allow businesses to stay open. #FightForSmallBiz https://t.co/LloCcBegp9
@realDonaldTrump outstanding selection as your nominee to the Supreme Court: Amy Coney Barrett. U.S. Senate quickly confirm this nominee!!!

It is true #PlasmaDonorsSaveLives and donating plasma has never been more important than it is now. Please consider helping your fellow Americans by finding a plasma donation center near you and donate your plasma! https://t.co/lSXfLdAPbu https://t.co/T4KaMaxN1m
As a physician and a father of four I understand the importance of ensuring the health of mothers during pregnancy and after the delivery of newborns.  https://t.co/puyrUzp8sE https://t.co/i1mIiC1dCR

If Dems had the WH and the Senate they would nominate and confirm a new Supreme Court Justice before the inauguration of the next President regardless of who wins the election. @realDonaldTrump and @senatemajldr ignore the noise and immediately seat a new conservative justice.
R.I.P Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Thank you for your service to your country.

As a co-chair of the Congressional Aluminum Caucus I am pleased to see @USTradeRep has removed tariffs on aluminum imports from Canada. This is good news for the more than 160000 American jobs in the U.S. aluminum industry including many in Indiana.

We are physicians in Congress & we believe a science-driven safe & effective vaccine to COVID19 will be available in the near future. When it is available we encourage you to get vaccinated. #OperationWarpSpeed @DrPhilRoe @RepBradWenstrup @RepAndyHarrisMD https://t.co/HRntsBf6ox
#OperationWarpSpeed is about getting America back to normal by finding a safe effective vaccine to COVID-19. https://t.co/c1Q0sJhB5T

I am pleased that my legislation to honor Ernie Pyle – a Pulitzer Prize winning journalist and Hoosier – by designating the U.S. Post Office located in his hometown of Dana Indiana as the Ernest ‘Ernie’ T. Pyle Post Office has passed the House. https://t.co/Tv2Nw8f3Ta

Let’s talk #OperationWarpSpeed. Members of the @gopdoccaucus are here to reassure you that the best and brightest scientists and doctors are working to deliver a safe and effective vaccine for COVID-19. https://t.co/mbOae59bBe

As the years pass since the tragic events of Sept. 11 2001 we must never forget what happened that fateful day. Take a moment to  remember the bravery and heroism on display that day and those that lost their lives in New York Virginia and Pennsylvania. https://t.co/FYli2f0zay

As a Veteran of a decade in the U.S. Navy Reserve I am appalled that Dems and their media allies would use our Veterans for political purposes. The accusations by anonymous sources that @realDonaldTrump made disparaging statements about our Veterans has been widely debunked.

I have signed the #PolicePledge to support our law enforcement officers. Each day they wake up kiss their loved ones goodbye and put themselves between us and danger. It's a noble profession and I will ALWAYS stand with them as they protect our communities and enforce our laws. https://t.co/V7Z1kYKVoj

Joe Biden and Democrats are now trying to blame @realDonaldTrump for the ongoing violence in our cities. This is laughable. They are following the polling and everyone including them know it.  They are losing.

This week I met with German American Bank CEO Mark Schroeder. They have helped Hoosier small businesses access the Paycheck Protection Program that has helped save Hoosier jobs and businesses. https://t.co/ilqf8OwhcU
Today is the anniversary of ratification on August 18 1920. https://t.co/RfwaEeTHxE

@realDonaldTrump my heartfelt condolences on the passing of your brother Robert. My wife Kathryn and I have your family in our thoughts and prayers.  LB

R.I.P. former Indiana Governor Joe Kernan. Thank you and your family for everyone’s service to our great state. My condolences to all of Governor Kernan’s family and friends.

We cannot slow the spread of COVID-19 if Americans have to continue to wait nearly 5 days to receive their test results. Bipartisan legislation that I have introduced with @RepDianaDeGette H.R. 7025 & 7026 will lead to faster results & increased capacity. https://t.co/EvonVUZLx5

@maureen_mofonts @JamieDrendel Glad you added yourself to my twitter followers. I’m trying for 1M. Think I’ll get there!

R.I.P. Congressman John Lewis. John was a civil rights icon who put his life on the line fighting for equality and subsequently represented his constituents with dignity and honor. I got to know John on our flights from Atlanta to Washington D.C. It was an honor to know him.

You are right @MickM2020 the next COVID relief package must include ways to increase our testing capacity. @RepDianaDeGette and I have bipartisan bills to help do just that https://t.co/vme7xLVtk5 https://t.co/EL2BR7d1ar

California Dems are releasing 8K prison inmates due to Covid 19 concerns. And now Dems and the media are losing their minds because @realDonaldTrump commuted Stone’s sentence which was the result of a politically motivated attack on the President? The hypocrisy is astounding.

https://t.co/vCw4pqzloY This week I joined the Washington Journal to discuss two bills I have authored with Rep. DeGette (D-CO). These bills would increase testing capacity and shorten turnaround time for results especially for rural and underserved communities. See it here:

Speaker Pelosi needs reminded that it was Pres. Obama who let the Russians take Crimea and who refused to give Ukraine lethal weapons to defend themselves against Russia not @realDonaldTrump. Pres. Trump forced Europe to contribute more to NATO and gave lethal weapons to Ukraine.

Today I met with Gibson County veterans service officer George Pickersgill. Our Veterans risked their lives to ensure our freedom and I will continue to support efforts to provide the highest quality support and care for them. https://t.co/gDHmUXGoe1

This morning I met with @LincolnlandEDC. I spoke with the Executive Director Randy Dennison and COO Tiffany Lampert Quinn about the importance of the Cares Act for states and local communities as well as the steps they are taking to keep their elderly housing facility safe. https://t.co/DqGrvrbrrw

On #Juneteenth we celebrate the end of slavery in the U.S. and the beginning of the journey towards living up to our founding principles. We've made great progress but there is still a road ahead if we are to equally secure the blessings of liberty and justice for all Americans.

I support the #JUSTICEAct as an original co-sponsor. Increased accountability improved training methods and further transparency between local state and federal law enforcement is a must if we are going to stop tragic events such as the death of George Floyd from happening. https://t.co/0AIj5Pu5uh
In D.C. today for another virtual hearing this time in the Health Subcommittee. https://t.co/oHXpFlifSk

I am deeply saddened at the unexpected passing of Carol Barr the wife of my friend and colleague Andy Barr from Kentucky. My heart is heavy and I want to express my condolences to Andy his two children and all of the family. Kathryn and I have them in our thoughts and prayers.
Happy Flag Day!! https://t.co/E7APivgQyW

George Floyd’s death is a tragedy and my prayers are with his family. Justice must be served. The arrest of former officer Derek Chauvin and the charges filed are the beginning. The anger and frustration are real and understandable. Rioting and looting however must stop.

I am disheartened & frustrated with House Dems inability to show up for work while health care workers and other frontline workers continue to show up in the face of uncertainty. I support this lawsuit to end the unconstitutional proxy voting scheme. https://t.co/CC2KAm8Ita

R.I.P. Congressman Sam Johnson. Sam was a true American hero having spent nearly seven years in a North Vietnamese prisoner of war “hotel”. He was also a dedicated public servant having served in Congress from 1991 to 2019. Sam will be missed.

Over 70 Dem Members are not present today for votes in DC Dems are in the minority without proxy voting. Any Dem bills brought up today could not pass under those circumstances. This is the reason they are counting proxy voting Members towards a quorum and allowing proxy votes.

Constitution Article 1 Section 5: ...and a Majority of each shall constitute a Quorum to do business; In the House that is 218 Members present. The House cannot create rules that are unconstitutional. Counting proxy voting Members towards a quorum is clearly unconstitutional.

It’s a shame to see 70 House Dems casting their vote using the unconstitutional proxy voting scheme giving away their vote & the voice of constituents in the People's House to @SpeakerPelosi. I am in DC today working on behalf of Hoosiers & making sure their voice is not silenced

My view of Arlington National Cemetery from the plane flying into and out of D.C. This weekend we remember and honor the fallen who have given their lives to protect and defend our liberty and freedom. https://t.co/EXok8XriGv

Now with proxy voting and Zoom type hearings Speaker Pelosi has kept the House out of session except for one day last week and two days next week. We are not in session this week. The voices of the American people are being silenced. Bring the House back into session.

The House isn’t in session this week after being in session one day last week. Next week we are in session for two days. The American people are looking to us for leadership during the pandemic. Speaker Pelosi bring the House into session to discuss the critical issues facing us.

My condolences to the family and friends of Terre Haute Firefighter John Schoffstall who passed away from Covid 19. First responders and healthcare workers are on the front lines in the fight against Covid 19. Help minimize their risk: follow the CDC and state guidelines.

Weeks ago Speaker Pelosi and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer held up much needed relief for American families and businesses playing politics and today they are needlessly holding American workers hostage to expedite their own political agenda.

It is our duty to ensure they can survive these uncertain times. As showcased by its popularity the Paycheck Protection Program is a vital component to relief for Americans and we cannot allow it to run dry. Congress must provide additional funding for the program.

Yet again Washington Democrats are unwilling to put politics aside and work with Republicans to quickly provide needed support for the American people during this health care crisis. Employers and employees across Indiana and the nation are hurting through no fault of their own.

The CARES Act included legislation I authored The Good Samaritan Health Professionals Act. It is important that health care volunteers stepping up to help our fellow Americans are protected from liabilities as they work to save lives during this crisis. https://t.co/SYZu3cp2Bp
